overview: From 2025-06-08 to 2025-06-15, elizaos/eliza had 106 new PRs (87 merged), 13 new issues, and 27 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Knowledge management (RAG) not working (implemented) in 1.0.6
topIssues.author: harperaa
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to get rag working and following docs, but that code is not implemented in 1.0.6.  It appears to be commented as a placeholder in 
 
**To Reproduce**

settings: {
    secrets: {},
    ragKnowledge: true,
  },
  knowledge: [
    {
      directory: 'knowledge/foobar',
      shared: true,
    },
  ],

**Expected behavior**

I expect that it would parse on startup and it was not doing that, as it used to do.  So, I looked into code and found this... summary from claude....

Missing Implementation Locations

  1. AgentRuntime Initialization Missing Knowledge 
  Processing

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 494-651)
  - The AgentRuntime.initialize() method should process
  character.knowledge but doesn't
  - No call to any knowledge processing function during
  agent startup

  2. TODO Comment Confirms Missing Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/specs/v1/index.ts (line 50)
  // TODO: Implement the remaining adapters: ... - 
  knowledge / memory
  This is a developer comment explicitly stating that
  knowledge processing is not implemented yet.

  3. Bootstrap Plugin Missing KNOWLEDGE Provider

  File: /packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/index.ts
  - Multiple message examples reference providers: 
  ['KNOWLEDGE'] in character files
  - But the bootstrap plugin doesn't export any KNOWLEDGE 
  provider
  - Provider list is incomplete - missing the knowledge
  provider entirely

  4. RagService Interface Exists But No Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 52-61)
  interface RagServiceDelegator extends Service {
    getKnowledge(message: Memory, scope?: { roomId?: UUID;
   worldId?: UUID; entityId?: UUID }):
  Promise<KnowledgeItem[]>;
    _internalAddKnowledge(item: KnowledgeItem, options?:
  any, scope?: any): Promise<void>;
  }
  The interface exists but no actual implementation of
  this service.

  5. Missing Functions

  - processCharacterKnowledge() - Referenced in docs but
  doesn't exist anywhere
  - No knowledge file reading/processing logic
  - No connection between character.knowledge array and
  embedding system

  Developer Comments Confirming This

  The codebase has explicit TODO comments indicating that
  knowledge/memory functionality is intentionally 
  unfinished. The character examples even reference
   a KNOWLEDGE provider that doesn't exist, suggesting
  this was planned but never implemented.

topIssues.title: Unable to load custom characters after upgrading to 1.0.7
topIssues.author: jonathanprozzi
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

After upgrading an existing project to use `@elizaos/core` version `1.0.7`, our custom character is no longer registered as an agent. Opening the chat interface/dev environment on `localhost` only shows Eliza as an agent and not our character. This previously worked with `1.0.6`. 

I tested with a newly scaffolded project and set up a character there as well and noticed the same behavior with only Eliza being shown as an agent.

**To Reproduce**

- Upgrade an existing project to use `"@elizaos/core": "^1.0.7"` or start a fresh one using this version
- Create a new character file with character settings and load that as the agent in the `index.ts`
- Start the server
- Open `localhost` to view the chat/dev environment and check if custom character is there -- we only saw Eliza and not our agent

Code snippets for characters:

`herbert.ts` snippet:

```typescript
export const herbert: Character = {
  name: 'Herbert',
  plugins: [
    '@elizaos/plugin-sql',
    ...(process.env.EVM_PRIVATE_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-evm'] : []),
    ...(process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-anthropic'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-openai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-knowledge'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-local-ai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.DISCORD_API_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-discord'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TWITTER_USERNAME ? ['@elizaos/plugin-twitter'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-telegram'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.IGNORE_BOOTSTRAP ? ['@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap'] : []),
  ],
... (more settings)
}
```

`index.ts`:
```typescript
const herbertAgent: ProjectAgent = {
  character: herbert,
  init: async (runtime: IAgentRuntime) => initCharacter({ runtime }),
};
const project: Project = {
  agents: [herbertAgent],
};
```

**Expected behavior**

- Expected that Eliza would find the new character (Herbert) and register it as an agent (previous behavior in existing project)
- We didn't change any config in the existing project but after upgrading versions we could no longer find/interact with Herbert

**Additional context**

- Tested this with both a newly scaffolded project as well as in an existing project. Our existing project had our custom agent/character loading but I then upgraded to `1.0.7` and Eliza is the only registered agent. Seems to possibly be using Eliza as a fallback and ignoring our custom character files, even though they're being detected when the server starts.

topIssues.title: Callback from plugin action not making it to end user response in chat
topIssues.author: jonathanprozzi
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

In using the `plugin-evm` transfer function we expect to see a followup message with either the success or failure of the transaction.

In the plugin's `transfer.ts` callback, we see the following:

https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-evm/blob/6bf9c4c54b9e1a558c7fb092f071f2e374435887/src/actions/transfer.ts#L133

```typescript
 if (callback) {
        callback({
          text: `Successfully transferred ${paramOptions.amount} tokens to ${paramOptions.toAddress}\nTransaction Hash: ${transferResp.hash}`,
          content: {
            success: true,
            hash: transferResp.hash,
            amount: formatEther(transferResp.value),
            recipient: transferResp.to,
            chain: paramOptions.fromChain,
          },
        });
      }
... (other error logging as well)
```

We see the following in our logs (added additional debugging console.log statements):

```bash
LOG:in the transfer action
CALLBACK IN EVM_TRANSFER_TOKENS [AsyncFunction (anonymous)]
in the transferResponse try block
transferResponse try block completed {
  hash: '0xd2680982067e0258612119a58497208428613debcd314d667bd758b93ea86ed8',
  from: '0x7850f8a9825d6dadfF5621300ee11f2dED76b76b',
  to: '0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94',
  value: 20000000000000000n,
  data: '0x'
}
[2025-06-09 19:25:35] INFO: [Eliza] Agent generated response for message. Preparing to send back to bus.
[2025-06-09 19:25:35] INFO: [Eliza] MessageBusService: Sending payload to central server API endpoint (/api/messages/submit):
    channel_id: "93487822-03c0-4119-bffc-13aca04fb41f"
    server_id: "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
    author_id: "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d"
    content: "I'll help you transfer 0.02 ETH to 0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94 on Sepolia. Processing the transaction now."
    in_reply_to_message_id: "18489676-ba76-4673-9a39-9f17fe686bc3"
    source_type: "agent_response"
    raw_message: {
      "text": "I'll help you transfer 0.02 ETH to 0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94 on Sepolia. Processing the transaction now.",
      "thought": "Process ETH transfer request on Sepolia network after checking balance",
      "actions": [
        "REPLY",
        "EVM_TRANSFER_TOKENS"
      ]
    }
    metadata: {
      "agent_id": "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d",
      "agentName": "Eliza",
      "channelType": "DM",
      "isDm": true
    }

```

The transfer is successful, but we only see the initial message of `"text": "I'll help you transfer 0.02 ETH to 0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94 on Sepolia. Processing the transaction now.",` in the Eliza chat interface.

We would expect to see a followup message with the success (or failure) text from the callback in the `transfer.ts` function.

We also triggered an unsuccessful transaction and did not receive a followup error message which the callback suggests we should see.

**To Reproduce**

- Bare Eliza scaffolded as a fresh project with the `plugin-anthropic` and `plugin-evm` added:

```bash
    "@elizaos/cli": "^1.0.6",
    "@elizaos/core": "^1.0.6",
    "@elizaos/plugin-anthropic": "^1.0.0",
    "@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap": "^1.0.6",
    "@elizaos/plugin-evm": "file:../plugin-evm",
    "@elizaos/plugin-knowledge": "^1.0.1",
    "@elizaos/plugin-openai": "^1.0.3",
    "@elizaos/plugin-sql": "^1.0.6",
    "zod": "3.24.2"
```

and the following Character config:

```typescript
 name: 'Eliza',
  plugins: [
    '@elizaos/plugin-sql',
    ...(process.env.EVM_PRIVATE_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-evm'] : []),
    ...(process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-anthropic'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-openai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-knowledge'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-local-ai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.DISCORD_API_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-discord'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TWITTER_USERNAME ? ['@elizaos/plugin-twitter'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-telegram'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.IGNORE_BOOTSTRAP ? ['@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap'] : []),
  ],
  settings: {
    secrets: {},
    chains: {
      evm: ['sepolia'],
    },
    ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
    ANTHROPIC_SMALL_MODEL: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-latest',
    ANTHROPIC_LARGE_MODEL: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-latest',
  },

```
Our private key and RPC are configured and work as the transfer is successful.


**Expected behavior**

Based on the callback in `transfer.ts` we expect to see a followup message indicating the success or failure of the transfer call.

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/06dae3fa-9b2c-4e49-b660-42f2d9f9837f)

At this stage, the transfer succeeds but this is the last message we received.

We would expect that there would be a followup message after this indicating the success or the failure, including (or similar to) the text in the `transfer.ts` callback (in the `plugin-evm` plugin):

`Successfully transferred ${paramOptions.amount} tokens to ${paramOptions.toAddress}\nTransaction Hash: ${transferResp.hash}`

**Additional context**

We're under the impression that this is a core callback issue and not with the `plugin-evm` itself as we're seeing similar behavior with a barebones example using the `plugin-mcp`. This is a more direct and more easily reproducible example to file.

topIssues.title: MessageBusService: Agent not a participant in channel {channelId}, ignoring message
topIssues.author: exitsimulation
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to send messages through the API using postman. The message goes through

POST /messages
```
{
  "entityId": "b8af647b-f617-0ae3-ab07-acb81861d7e2",
  "roomId": "46bf60b4-cfa4-4ec4-a9f3-db1ec9ab0aa1",
  "channelId": "89591c0f-7b20-45a0-9266-56a6ce68de13",
  "serverId": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000",
  "text": "Test Message!",
  "source": "postman"
}
```

Response:
```
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "message": "Message submitted to central store. Target agent b8af647b-f617-0ae3-ab07-acb81861d7e2 will process it.",
        "messageId": "11346cd8-46f2-4a7e-ae71-b6e72ee865ee",
        "targetAgentId": "b8af647b-f617-0ae3-ab07-acb81861d7e2",
        "submittedChannelId": "89591c0f-7b20-45a0-9266-56a6ce68de13"
    }
}
```

However in the logs it says `[test-agent] MessageBusService: Agent not a participant in channel 89591c0f-7b20-45a0-9266-56a6ce68de13, ignoring message`

The strange thing is that I am already running a setup routine through a custom plugin to set a channel, room and add the agent as participant on this channel. See here:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fe11e37b-0925-4498-a3a2-0985c70151ab)


After running this I am inspecting the live database and the channel_participants relation is there:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d5524f18-31e9-46bb-983e-3973c7140c44)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/18921312-949d-47b2-83e3-73cc663fce73)

**Theory**: 
MessageBusService seems to access stale data in regards to channel participants.

Is there any way to fix this?

completedItems.title: fix: envs loading on default eliza

Fix for envs not loading in bun run start with default character eliza.

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Merged PR #5007 to fix matrix run on Windows (+3/-0 lines) and opened PR #5009 for lockfile cleanup in GitHub fallback installations. Made substantial code changes across 34 files (+1036/-511 lines) in 11 commits, with primary focus split between other work (45%) and bugfix work (36%).

ChristopherTrimboli: Made substantial code changes with 5 commits modifying 209 files (+28,016/-16,749 lines), primarily focused on other work (80%) with some refactoring (20%). Activity was concentrated on a single day during this period.

yungalgo: Merged 4 significant PRs this week, including a major refactoring effort to centralize directory detection with monorepo support (#5011, +584/-400 lines) and fixing runtime initialization issues (#5092, +759/-591 lines). Contributed substantial code changes across 110 files (+3654/-1672 lines) with a focus on refactoring and bug fixes, while maintaining 3 open PRs for ongoing improvements to directory type detection and project placement.

tcm390: Merged 11 PRs this week, primarily focused on bug fixes including file uploading (#5115, +4381/-3524 lines), memory duplication (#5103), and removing the default bot (#5083). Created 3 issues related to plugin duplicates, agent participation, and file upload failures, with consistent activity across 5 days. Made substantial code changes across 143 files (+5166/-5123 lines total) while maintaining a steady workflow of identifying issues and implementing fixes.

0xbbjoker: Fixed a critical bug with PR #5006 "fix(logs): resolve empty logs display with existing data" (+84/-43 lines), which addressed an issue where logs weren't displaying properly despite data being available. This single contribution represented their only activity this week, focusing entirely on bugfix work across 3 modified files.

lalalune: Led major refactoring efforts with 4 merged PRs, including replacing cursor rules (#5021), splitting core types (#5020), rebuilding plugin-sql with dynamic database table loading (#5018), and adding dummy services (#5030), totaling over +63k/-65k lines across 2644 files. Contributed 23 commits across 3 days, primarily focused on refactoring (22%) and bug fixes (13%), while also opening 2 PRs that remain in progress. Provided 5 review comments on other PRs, demonstrating collaborative engagement alongside substantial code restructuring work.

odilitime: Made significant code changes across 51 files (+373/-6179 lines) while merging two PRs: #5026 adding target to Content and #5054 fixing `bun run dev`. Provided substantial review activity with 10 reviews (2 approvals, 8 comments) and 1 PR comment, showing consistent engagement across 3 days this week.

standujar: Merged two significant bug fix PRs this week: #5045 addressing SQL plugin agent ID issues (+1784/-4849 lines) and #5058 improving Content Security Policy and API error handling (+533/-4332 lines). Contributed actively across 3 days with 17 commits modifying 313 files (+21514/-24617 lines total), while also providing 1 approval review and 10 PR comments.
github-advanced-security: Provided 10 review comments this week, though with sporadic activity during the period. No code changes, PRs, or issue activity was recorded.

samarth30: Opened PR #5066 "feat: updated plugin migrator" with substantial code changes (+5827/-1522 lines) across 23 files. Active on 2 days this week, with contributions primarily focused on feature work (65%) and refactoring (12%), touching both code (63%) and test files (21%).

madjin: Completed a substantial documentation update through PR #5046 "chore: Update docs" (+23453/-28011 lines) that modified 396 files, with 95% of changes focused on documentation. Active on 2 days this week, contributing 14 commits across this large documentation overhaul.

alex-nax: Opened PR #5057 to update agent to use eliza v1.x, making substantial code changes across 26 files (+3705/-203 lines) with a focus on configuration files (44%), tests (14%), and documentation (14%). Contributed to one issue discussion during their single day of activity this week.

0xCardiE: Contributed a single significant feature PR #5113 "feat: add API points to manage channels" (+203/-0 lines) that was merged this week. The PR added functionality for channel management through API endpoints, with no code removal required.
coderwander: Made a small documentation improvement by fixing typos in PR #5031 (+2/-2 lines), which was merged after 8 hours.
derjogi: Fixed a Postgres migration schema selection issue with PR #5072 (+372/-567 lines), which was merged after 9 hours. Commented on one issue during their single day of activity this week.

consentsam: Made a small documentation improvement with PR #5078 (+2/-2 lines), updating CLI examples in the agent documentation to replace "-t" with "--type". This was their only contribution during the period, focusing entirely on documentation accuracy.
davidjsonn: Made a small documentation contribution by fixing typos in the gitcoin-passport.md file through PR #5008 (+2/-2 lines), which was merged within 2 hours.

urosognjenovic: Opened one pull request (#5119) to remove a duplicated ID link from sidebars, making a small documentation improvement with 4 lines removed across one file. Activity was limited to a single day this week.

jonathanprozzi: Focused on issue reporting and discussion, creating two issues (#5017 about plugin callback problems and #5039 regarding custom character loading after an upgrade) with the latter being closed. Contributed to ongoing discussions by commenting on 5 different issues, showing engagement with the project despite not making code changes.

harperaa: Reported two issues this week: #5005 regarding LOG_LEVEL from .env not working in version 1.0.6 and #5004 about knowledge management (RAG) functionality not working in the same version. Contributed to discussions by commenting on two existing issues, showing engagement with the project despite not submitting any code changes.
snobbee: Created issue #5095 regarding "Failed to create entity for agent" which was subsequently closed. No other activity this week.

exitsimulation: Reported two issues this week, including a closed issue (#4972) about MessageBusService agent participation in channels and an open issue (#5121) regarding an API endpoint not found. Added a comment on one issue, with sporadic activity during this period.
SyedMuqeetAqib: Created issue #5060 proposing to add optional Stream responses for handling streaming functionality. Commented on one issue this week, with no code contributions or PR activity.
furkannabisumji: Created one issue (#5117) related to "bedrock" which remains open. No other activity was observed during this period.

ceeriil: Reported one issue (#5023) about GPT-4o access errors with OpenAI API keys, which has since been closed. Contributed to discussions by commenting on two existing issues. No code contributions or pull requests during this period.
agent671: Created one issue (#5074) inquiring about the status of the agent-twitter-client repository. No other activity was observed this week.
